Warmies are safe, soft, and more absorbent than cotton or disposable wipes- meaning you need less to get the job done. Using reusable wipes for your baby is the environmentally conscious decision. Warmies are perfect for all of Baby' delicate needs. From the Manufacturer Reusable cloth wipes- 100% rayon derived from bamboo. Warmies are safe, soft, and more absorbent than cotton or disposable wipes- meaning you need less to get the job done. Using reusable wipes for your baby keeps tons of trash out of landfills annually, making Warmies the environmentally conscious decision. Warmies are the responsible way to wash and are perfect for all of Baby' delicate needs.

manufacturerProductDescription.media_text: Finally - a wipes warmer that is soft on baby and reusable. Consider this a green machine, designed specifically to warm reusable wipes while keeping them moist and fresh. Special care went into the design of the insulation within the interior walls as well as the main lid accessibility, making it ideal for families who go green with their reusable wipes and/or homemade solutions. The Warmies Wipes Warmer can hold about a week's worth of wipes - approximately sixteen Warmies Wipes or twenty-five thinner cotton wipes - and can accommodate any cloth wipe. Whether folded or rolled, this wipes warmer is the perfect addition to any cloth diapered bottom.

Warmies Wipes Warmer Warmies Wipes Warmer Cloth diapers are washable and reusable, and so are cloth wipes. What's even better than a cloth wipe is a warm cloth wipe. This wipes warmer does its part to ensure you are sending LESS trash to the landfills while keeping baby's bottom nice and warm. And, it is only 12V, so the energy required is the same as a tiny Christmas tree light. Everyone wins! Reusable Bamboo Cloth Prince Lionheart's Warmies Wipes are so much softer than disposable wipes, and can be used again and again. These reusable cloth wipes are made from 100% bamboo rayon, with no dyes or bleaches, so you can save the landfills one wipe at a time. We include Warmies with every Warmies Wipes Warmer, with more available for purchase separately. Extra Warmies are available for purchase as it can hold sixteen Warmies Wipes. Warmies Wipes Warmer & Diaper Depot We wanted to create a wipes warmer that helped reduce waste, while providing Baby with a happy and hygienic diaper change. Check. We also design safety into everything we do, so the Warmies Wipes Warmer has been molded to fit perfectly on top of our Diaper Depots. Now one hand can always remain on baby while accessing all necessary diaper changing supplies. Check.

What is the secret to keeping a 100% reusable cloth wipe moist and warm? How does the everFRESH system work exactly? How does the everFRESH system work exactly? The everFRESH system was invented to solve a problem. How do you keep all the wipes warm, especially reusable cloth wipes? From the bottom up. After all, heat rises. The everFRESH pillow consists of billions of tiny chambers that are saturated with water and an anti-microbial solution. The saturated pillow is placed in the Water Reservoir, a special tray designed to keep it elevated from the heating surface. As the pillow is warmed, water vapor and the anti-microbial molecules are slowly released into the wipes chamber keeping the reusable cloth wipes warm, moist, fresh, and clean. The entire stack of bamboo cloth wipes is warmed ... bottom to top ... with no yellow, dried out wipes. The everFRESH System keeps cloth wipes moist by an evaporation and condensation process. Highly dense micropores in the pillow trap and release water as needed to maintain moisture content. Both the wipe warmer tub and the everFRESH pillow are treated with a proprietary germ-fighting additive to inhibit the growth of microorganisms that may cause spoilage, odors, and mildew. Parents love knowing their baby is getting the freshest diaper change possible while using the everFRESH pillow. How often do the pillows need to be replaced? Every 3 months. Have a recipe or need a recipe suggestion for your reusable wipes solution? We include some all-time favorite, simple recipes for happy bottoms, with ingredients you can pronounce!

You know about cloth diapers right? Why not a wipes warmer that uses reusable cloth warmies? PRO WARMIES Tip - We recommend starting up to 16 bamboo cloth WARMIES to start. Wait about 3 hours to warm and you should be good to go.

Warmies Wipes Warmer from Prince Lionheart EVO Wipes Warmer from Prince Lionheart Ultimate Wipes Warmer from Prince Lionheart Premium Wipes Warmer from Prince Lionheart Wipes Warmer POP from Prince Lionheart Antimicrobial Lining ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ Self-Sealing Wipes Lid ✓ ✓ Built-In Night Light ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ ✓ everFRESH System ✓ everFRESH Pillow + TipTop Pillow ✓ ✓ ✓ Multiple Colors Available ✓ Warming Temperature 103-112 F 99-103 F 99-100 F 100-102 F 98-100 F Wipe Capacity 15-80 Reusable Cloth Wipes OR 80-100 Disposable Wipes 80-100 Disposable Wipes 80-100 Disposable Wipes 80-100 Disposable Wipes 80-100 Disposable Wipes Size 10" x 6.5" x 5" 10" x 6.75" x 4" 13.25" x 4" x 4" 10" x 6.5" x 5" 10" x 7.5" x 5"

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on February 24, 2010
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Use a lingerie bag
reviews.reviewText: I've been using a combination of these wipes and Babykicks for 5 months now. These wipes are bulkier than the Babykicks, so fewer fit in the warmer. However, they are very soft and textured nicely to clean baby's bum effectively. The instructions do say not to put them in the dryer; when I did by accident, two of them did fray at the edges.However, I avoid this problem easily by keeping a mesh lingerie bag near our changing table and placing the dirties in there. When it's time to wash, I zip the bag, throw it in the wash, and pull the bag out between washer and dryer. Using this method, the Warmies are actually outlasting the Babykicks (which I also like), which are starting to become thin with wear. It also convenient because when baby wears G-diapers, I can throw the plastic liners in and keep them out of the dryer, too. Overall, I recommend as long as you can find an easy laundering routine.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on April 19, 2020
reviews.reviewText: I LOVE THESE! Super soft and durable and 1 wipe cleans them up! Bought some more and told my friends. Don't hesitate. Pick these.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on May 24, 2011
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Favorite baby item
reviews.reviewText: I love these towels! I used them instead of disposable wipes; in fact, I can brag that I didn't use a single reusable wipe for two kids. The towels are extremely soft on new skin and hold the perfect amount of moisture for cleaning up messy diapers. I never used the warmer, but my kids never minded cold water. The only down side is that they tend to fray if not washed carefully according to the instructions. I tend to be rough on laundry and don't always follow the directions, so that's my fault. Otherwise they hold up well.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on December 16, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars A little pricey, but you get what you pay for
reviews.reviewText: These wipes are great! We are cloth diapering and needed wipes. These really do a great job cleaning up after a poopy diaper. They don’t smear it around like the other cloth wipes I have. They aren’t as soft after a few washes, but still a great product. I have ordered more.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 23, 2010
reviews.reviewTitle: 4.0 out of 5 stars Just right for the job!
reviews.reviewText: Received these along with the Prince Lionheart wipes warmer at my baby shower and thought they were both totally unecessary...but kept them since it was a well-meant gift. Now I think of these as indispensible! Gets the baby cleaner than disposable wipes, with no chemicals and no waste.As stated in other reviews, the bamboo material is somewhat delicate and may fray at the edges- IF you don't care for them. But care is simple! I keep a lingerie bag next to the changing table and place used wipes in it. When I get 5 or so wipes soiled, I toss the whole bag in the washer with other baby clothes or cloth diapers. You don't need to dry them (they're WET wipes!) This has worked great, my baby is now 4 months old and we're still using the original wipes. We do also use other, thinner cotton wipes (available on Amazon also), generally for pee-only diaper changes. But these thicker bamboo ones are fabulous for cleaning up poopy messes!My favorite part is that I mix a few drops of tea tree oil, lavender oil, olive oil and organic baby soap in 2 cups of water and pour this mix over the wipes before putting them in the warmer. The end result is a soft, warm wipe that smells great, softens baby's skin AND we've never had diaper rash! LOVE this product!----UPDATE: my baby is now 8 months old and we're still using the same wipes, which get washed in hot water every few days, and I'm now too lazy to mess with the lingerie bag ;) They just go in the wash with the diapers and that's that. Oh, sometimes they go through the dryer too. A couple have frayed at the edge but we still use them. Am back today to order more since we never use disposable wipes any more. These are great!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on January 21, 2017
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Buy THESE for your WARMIES WIPES WARMER
reviews.reviewText: Softest baby wipes EVER. I purchased 3 or 4 different kinds of wipes at the same time, and these are by far my favorite. I purchased them t so they'd fit in the Wipes Warmer - and they do fit beautifully. Some of the others I bought are a little too large to fit in the Warmer, plus these are so exceptionally soft, I'm going back to purchase more. Thanks so much for such a great product!

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on August 4, 2018
reviews.reviewTitle: 5.0 out of 5 stars Perfect for reusable baby wipes
reviews.reviewText: I have bought several sets of these to use on two separate kids over the last 5 years and they've lasted very well through constant Washings, wiping, and water and coconut oil. I think I've only had to throw away maybe two or three from just wear and tear the rest of them held up so well I'm really impressed with these.if you're trying to make your own wipes at home I highly recommend this brand and these wipes.

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United States on September 27, 2017
reviews.reviewText: We LOVE these wash clothes. I soak them in water with a little coconut oil & lavender and use them for washable wipes. I now HATE having to change my son anywhere but at home because I have to use normal wipes. These are so soft and the perfect size to use with the wipe warmer they sell. Highly reccomend these!
buon prodotto un po' ruvide all'inizio ma poi si ammorbidiscono

reviews.reviewTitle: Softest, most durable, perfect size cloths for baby's face or diapering.
reviews.reviewText: I am using these for cloth diapering wipes, and they are fabulous! So so soft, and the edges are good and sturdy. I waited for a few months of washes before reviewing just to make sure they didn't start to show defects, but they are still lovely, they are the only ones I have that stay soft and they are the perfect size, plus they dry fast. I wish they'd make a colored version so I could buy them for facecloths and keep them separate. PS I have bought FIVE other types of cloth wipes, including Grovia, Applecheeks and other bamboo brands, these are BY FAR the best, I wish I had bought these all in the first place!
Impeccable pour l'utilisation du Chauffe Lingettes Warmies. C'est exactement ce que j'attendais, je suis très satisfaite de cet achat et je recommande sans modération

reviews.reviewDate: Reviewed in the United Kingdom on August 29, 2013
reviews.reviewTitle: A quality product , very soft, suitably packaged with details of use
reviews.reviewText: I bought these wipes as an alternative to regular wet wipes. The reason I did not wanted to use the wipes from the market, was that most contain chemicals. So, I was happy to find a natural alternative on this bamboo wipes. Very quality wipes, I believe 75% made of bamboo and 25% of cotton), they are very soft and very absorbent. I soaked the wipes in a natural liquid created by me of: water, natural baby soap/shower gel, grapeseed 100% pure carrier oil, sweet almond oil and chamomile decoction.My sweet baby girl feels very happy now :)
